question: Is the formation of TCR/CD3 microdomains required to induce the immunological synapse during T cellâ€“antigen-presenting cell interactions? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: T cell receptor (TCR-CD3) triggering involves both receptor clustering and conformational changes at the cytoplasmic tails of the CD3 subunits.
content.source_2: Despite antigen engagement, the CD3 conformational switch was observed under conditions that prevented TCR aggregation, and this alone supported immunologic synapse assembly, indicating that TCR/CD3 microdomains are dispensable for synapse induction.
content.source_3: This conformational change at CD3 reverts upon ligand dissociation and is required for T cell activation.
content.source_4: Super-resolution imaging and acute cholesterol depletion dispersed TCR/CD3 nanoclusters without impairing central supramolecular activation cluster (cSMAC) formation or sustained calcium flux, demonstrating that immunologic synapse formation does not depend on CD3 microdomain integrity.
